bibl.title: Letter from Maria Teresa Rojas and Lydia Cabrera to [Mary Hench?], December 20, 1949

div1.p: Rojas inquires whether Philip Hench is still investigating the yellow fever story. She has heard about Hench's discovery of a new arthritis treatment, and would like to know more about it. Rojas discusses her and Lydia's work.

div1.head: Letter from Maria Teresa Rojas and Lydia Cabrera to [Mary Hench?], December 20, 1949

opener.dateline:
QUINTA SAN JOSE
REDENCION
MARIANAO-CUBA
December 20th, 1949

div1.p:
With the approach of Christmas
we have been talking of our journey last
year and our unexpected meeting with you
on the boat train and we are very anxious
to have news from you.

We are as you will understand very
interested to know if Dr. Hench is still
working on the Yellow Fever investigations
and what are the most recent developments?

Remembering our enjoyable conversations
on the boat we recall with special interest
what you told us of the Doctors recent
discoveries of a medicine for arthritis -
and our enquiry is made from motives
of necessity as Lydia has a very dear
sister who has been suffering for several
years and naturally we would wish to do
anything possible to alliviate her condition
so that any indications you can let us
have towards obtaining the medicine will
be greatly appreciated-

All this year both of us have been
working overtime- Lydia on a third
book of folklore of Cuba and myself
very modestly drowsing among the
remaining documents from the past which
I am preparing for publication before
the originals are eaten away in the
Archives of the City.

Once these activities concluded we
hope to go again to Europe for a rest
& change.

Do please let us hear from you &
tell us your plans for next year -
which we hope will be for you all a
very happy one - & so wishing you a
“Merry Christmas” from Lydia & myself.

With our affectionate regards to you all
& a specially warm message to the Doctor of
whom we often speak.
